A web or spiderweb is a barrier found in some poorly-maintained corridors, especially those found underground. For example, there are spiderwebs just east of the deadly red spiders in Varrock Sewers, in the Mage Arena, at the Deserted Keep, in the Yanille Agility dungeon, and in the Temple of Ikov dark room that contains the boots of lightness.

To pass through a spiderweb, players can wield a blade (such as an axe or a bladed weapon like a longsword) to slash it. Alternatively, player can right-click the weapon or knife in their inventory and use it on the web to pass through. This will not always be successful, but failure does not have any particular consequences except that the player will need to try again. The chances for success are as follows:[1]

  • 100% for any tier of Wilderness sword or a weapon with a slash bonus of at least +100
  • 50% for slashing swords and knives
  • 20% for weapons with a slash bonus of at least +1
  • The chance for weapons with a slash bonus of +20 to +99 is scaled based on the slash bonus

Contents

  • 1 Locations
  • 2 Trivia
  • 3 Changes
  • 4 References

Locations[edit | edit source]

Location Members Spawns Map
Kruk's Dungeon17Maplink
Forthos Dungeon6Maplink
Eastern Wilderness Ruins3Maplink
Mage Arena5Maplink
Temple of Ikov1Maplink
Lava Maze2Maplink
Entrance to Yanille Agility dungeon4Maplink
Varrock Sewers1Maplink
Kruk's Dungeon, 1st floor[UK]2nd floor[US]25Maplink

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • You can cut through webs using a broken weapon such as a Guthan's warspear.
  • Although the last web in front of Sarachnis' lair has an option to peek, peeking gives a message as if you used a listen option instead. This message also does not end with a full stop. "You listen and hear no adventurers inside the crypt"

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
28 October 2020
(update)

Non-weapon items with a positive slash attack bonus, such as amulets, can no longer be used to cut webs.

22 August 2019
(update)

Any weapon with a slash bonus now has a chance to slash through a web, with the success rate depending on the weapon's slash bonus. No weapon's chance to slash through webs has been decreased by this change.

20 August 2015
(update)

Spider webs on ceilings will no longer distort at certain camera angles.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ↑ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 22 August 2019. (Archived from the original on 12 January 2021.) Mod Ash: "For those who like to know the rates of things, here's the new chances of slashing webs now that you can do it with any weapon that's got a slash accuracy bonus:"

A '''web''' or '''spiderweb''' is a barrier found in some poorly-maintained corridors, especially those found underground. For example, there are spiderwebs just east of the [[deadly red spider]]s in [[Varrock Sewers]], in the [[Mage Arena]], at the [[Deserted Keep]], in the [[Yanille Agility dungeon]], and in the [[Temple of Ikov]] dark room that contains the [[boots of lightness]].

To pass through a spiderweb, players can wield a blade (such as an axe or a bladed weapon like a longsword) to slash it. Alternatively, player can right-click the weapon or knife in their inventory and use it on the web to pass through. This will not always be successful, but failure does not have any particular consequences except that the player will need to try again. The chances for success are as follows:{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/1164479217804947456|date=22 August 2019|archiveurl=https://archive.is/YQU3Z|archivedate=12 January 2021|quote=For those who like to know the rates of things, here's the new chances of slashing webs now that you can do it with any weapon that's got a slash accuracy bonus:}}

*100% for any tier of [[Wilderness sword]] or a weapon with a slash bonus of at least +100
*50% for [[Weapons/Types#Slash_swords|slashing swords]] and [[knives]]
*20% for weapons with a slash bonus of at least +1
*The chance for weapons with a slash bonus of +20 to +99 is scaled based on the slash bonus
